name: beauty
content:
beauty noun
(BEING BEAUTIFUL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ U ] the quality of being pleasing and attractive, especially to look at: natural beauty This is an area of outstanding natural beauty. She believes that beauty comes from within. The piece of music he played had a haunting beauty.
[ C ] a person or thing that is pleasing and attractive, especially to look at: Different cultures and eras have different ideas of what makes someone a great beauty. The caterpillar is a beauty - white with yellow and black markings - but it turns into an everyday, dull, brown moth.
[ U ] the business of making people look attractive, using make-up, treatments, etc.: beauty products/treatments a beauty therapist/salon She said that people are now spending money on beauty and wellness because they realise it is good for them. This is a beauty brand inspired by Ayurveda - the traditional Indian system of medicine.
More examplesFewer examplesWe admired the beauty of the sunset.I don't think people should get surgery to meet contemporary standards of beauty.The beauty and range of his voice distinguishes him from other tenors.Not everyone appreciates the beauty of maths.She loved the beauty and fruitfulness of the autumn, when the whole countryside was ablaze with rich golden colours.It was a scene of indescribable beauty.The last day of the holiday was a beauty, with a warm breeze and a blue sky.
